metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8326 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The IPTables-Parse module before 1.6 for Perl allows local users to writeto arbitrary files owned by the current user.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libiptables-parse-perl - 1.1-1+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libiptables-parse-perl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1-1+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
